chapter.title: Configuration Reference
chapter.para: This section is a quick index for looking up configuration. Click on the element name to go to the specific chapter.

section.title: jbm-configuration.xml
section.para: This is the main core server configuration file.

row.entry: true means that the server is clustered
true means that the server will load configuration from the configuration files
true means that the server will use the file based journal for persistence.
the number of threads that the main scheduled thread pool has.

true means that security is enabled

true means that the server supports wild card routing
the name of the management address to send management messages to

the password used to for replicating management operations between clustered nodes

true means that the management API is available via JMX
true means that message counters are enabled

how many days to keep message counter history
how often (in ms) to scan for failed connections on the server

how often (in ms) to scan for expired messages

JBoss Messaging enters into global page mode as soon as the total memory consumed by messages hits this value (in bytes)

section.title: jbm-jms.xml
section.para: This is the configuration file used by the server side JMS service to load JMS Queues, Topics and Connection Factories

row.entry: a list of connection factories to create and add to JNDI
the pre-configured client ID for the connection factory
the period (in ms) between ping packets being sent from client to server
the time to live (in ms) for connections
the timeout (in ms) for remote calls
the maximum number of connections per factory
the size (in bytes) before a message is treated as large
the window size (in bytes) for consumer flow control
the fastest rate a consumer may consume messages per second
the window size (in bytes) for sending messages
the maximum rate of messages per second that can be sent
whether or not messages are acknowledged synchronously
whether or not non persistent messages are sent synchronously
whether or not persistent messages are sent synchronously
whether or not message grouping is automatically used
whether messages are pre acknowledged by the server before sending
the batch size (in bytes) between acknowledgements when using DUPS_OK_ACKNOWLEDGE mode
the batch size (in bytes) between acknowledgements when using a transactional session
the name of the load balancing class
the initial time to wait (in ms) for discovery groups to wait for broadcasts
whether or not to use a global thread pool for threads
the size of the scheduled thread pool
the size of the thread pool
the time (in ms) to retry a connection after failing
multiplier to apply to successive retry intervals
maximum number of retry attempts, -1 signifies infinite
whether or not to failover on server shutdown
a queue to create and add to JNDI
context where the queue will be bound in JNDI (there can be many)
